Posts.Content: I have posted on this site several times. My mother was diagnosed with breast cancer two years ago. Since then it has metastis to her spinal fluid and then to her brain fluid. I am not going to embellish on this. This disease is horrible. My mother lost her battle with this disease on Aug.4, 2006. She was a brave woman and refused to let it take her until she was ready. If anyone has any questions on the signs that occur during the course of this disease they can email me directly at --- Message edited by CancerCompass staff: for personal protection, email address removed. Please review CancerCompass Member Guidelines at http://www.cancercompass.com/common/guidelines.html ----. I will be happy to try and help any way that I can and my heart goes out to anyone who has this or lost a family member to this awful cancer.
Posts.Title: Carcinomatous Menigitis

Posts.Content: Hello, I read your posting and was wondering how your family member is doing? My mother has the same disease and she swears that she is going to beat this. Any insight into the symptoms that she will face good and bad would be of great help. Thank you
Posts.Title: Treatment for: carcinomatous meningitis

Posts.Content: Dear Sir, You seem to know a lot about this disease. I am very sorry for your loss. i was wondering if you could possibly give me the specific symptoms that your loved one endured during the end. My mother is at home with hospice and is in complete denial. She swears that she is going to beat this cancer. She is experiencing shakes, vision problems hearing problems and equilibium instability. She confuses me. I am not sure what to do. Is she fooling me or herself or both? She was first diagnosed with breast cancer two years ago and was diagnosed last June with cancer cells in her spinal fluid and in the brain. She refuses to bathe and is not getting enough fluids. I can't be there because of finances and she swears that she's going to move here in June. Is that possible or is she just living in a fantasy? I would appreciate any help.
Posts.Title: Treatment for: carcinomatous meningitis

Posts.Content: I have posted here several times and would like to update everyone reading that my mother lost her courageous battle on Aug.4, 2006. She was very strong and refused to let this cancer take her unless it was on her terms. My heart goes out to anyone with this disease or anyone who lost someone special to this morbid disease. For those of you who have this, enjoy every moment of every day and remind those that you love that you cherish them deeply.
